basics.name: Joey Quinlan
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: 4th year honors computing science student at the University of Alberta, looking to explore the universe with code

work.name: University of Alberta
work.summary: Utilized deep learning to create a video processing application capable of detecting and tracking 15 classes of vehicles, gathering metadata such as timestamps and entry/exit directions.

work.name: Promise Robotics
work.summary: Designed a computer vision system from the ground up utilizing StereoLabs ZED SDK.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Introduction to File and Database Management

awards.title: TC Energy STEM Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for demonstrating strong community commitment and passion for innovation

awards.title: NSERC Undergraduate Student Research Award
awards.awarder: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada
awards.summary: Awarded for academic excellence and research potential

publications.name: Active Learning for Multi-Class Vehicle Categorization and Traffic Analysis in complex environments
publications.summary: A framework for implementing active learning to train deep learning vehicle detection and classification models for a vehicle tracking application

projects.name: Autonomous Driving
projects.summary: Co-Leading the new Autonomous Driving Subteam of the Formula Student Racing Engineering Club at the UofA. Helping Build the software stack from the ground up using ROS2, Docker, C++/Python. Creating an autonomous RC car as a minimum viable product
highlights: Onboarding new members with a streamlined development environment setup document as well as baseline knowledge acquisition tasks
Containerized all software so development is streamlined across environments
Planned high level architecture of autonomy stack and building it with ROS2 and C++/Python

projects.name: Autonomous Foosball, with a Twist!
projects.summary: Helped create an autonomous system where two robots play a foosball/pong like game against each other, attempting to either score on each other, or pass for as long as possible
highlights: Constructed the arena, including the boundaries, pulley systems, players, and camera stand
Calibrated a fixed-camera system to obtain position accuracies within ~0.2 cm
Engineered a multi-threaded image processing loop to track ball movements at ~28 fps
